zone.line: We have felt the wand of Power, and leap--
Semichorus 2
As the billows leap in the morning beam
Chorus
Weave the dance on the floor of the breeze,
Pierce with song Heaven's silent light,
Enchant the Day that too swiftly flees
To soothe its flight, ere the cave of Night;
check
Once the hungry Hours were hounds
Which chased the Day, like a bleeding deer
And it limped and stumbled with many wounds
r
Though the nightly dells of the desart year
But now -- oh weave the mystic measure
Of music & dance and shapes of light,
Let the Hours & all Spirits of might &
pleasure
Like the clouds & the sunbeams unite
a Voice
Unite{!}
Panthea
See where the Spirits of the human mind
Wrapt sounds veils, approach
Clothed
in sweet song, like radiant garments,
